After digging around a bit trying to debug this problem, I think the
root c=
ause is in the class
ReplayCharSequenceFactory.MultiByteReplayCharSequence =
at the method

private void deleteFile(File fileToDelete, final Exception e=
) {
            if (e !=3D null) {
                // Log why the delete to=
 help with debug of
java.io.FileNotFoundException:
                // ....t=
t53http.ris.UTF-16BE.
                logger.severe("Deleting " + fileToDel=
ete + " because of "
                    + e.toString());
            }
   =
         if (fileToDelete !=3D null && fileToDelete.exists()) {
           =
     fileToDelete.delete();
            }
        }

The last line "fileToD=
elete.delete()" seems to always return false
when invoked from ExtractorHTM=
L, indicating that the file cannot be
deleted (perhaps due to a stream stil=
l being open on it).  This then
snowballs into the error seen in my previou=
s post.
    Has anyone any idea on what's causing this, and how to fix? 
Th=
anks much in advance.
